content: lace angels 4mm hook and dk or 4-ply yarn in white or cream international instructions for us treble_crochet→double_crochet half_double_crochet→half_double_crochet htr2tog yrh insert hook through front loop of st and back loop of next st yrh draw loop through 3 loops on hook yrh draw through 3 work 3ch for each 1st treble_crochet and 2ch for each 1st half_double_crochet body and head start with magic_ring 1 treble_crochet chain x6 slip_stitch to join 2 treble_crochet chain x12 slip_stitch to join 3 treble_crochet chain x24 slip_stitch to join 4 treble_crochet 2ch x24 slip_stitch to join 5 4 chain slip_stitch into treble_crochet x24 commence head attached at last slip_stitch 6 8 half_double_crochet all over last slip_stitch curve into a circle slip_stitch to join 7 2 half_double_crochet into next st x8 slip_stitch to join 8 16 half_double_crochet slip_stitch to join 9 16 half_double_crochet slip_stitch to join 10 chain 8 htr2tog stuff head lightly slip_stitch to join 11 20 chain slip_stitch top of head closed fasten_off wings sew through all layers start with magic_ring leaving a long tail 1 treble_crochet chain x10 slip_stitch to join 2 treble_crochet chain x20 slip_stitch to join 3 treble_crochet chain x40 slip_stitch to join 4 4 chain slip_stitch into treble_crochet x40 fasten_off fold wings almost in half so that larger part is toward the back and use long tail to sew centre to back of head at base tack down middle of wings and body through all layers folding sides of body inwards and catching fronts finish with lower edge of wings at centre of body fasten_off you may reproduce this pattern for charitable purposes © fay rowland 2025
